title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, March 16, 1866
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife and complains he has not heard from her since he left home. He sends instructions for preparing fields and garden for planting. He reports on his eye injury, the renovations going on at the hotel, the political climate in Staunton, and purchase and sale of property. He also includes instructions for building a garden fence.
keywords: Agriculture, Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
